matched.actualTitle: HTML Entity Encoding Bypass of Blacklist Filter on XSS Challenge 20
matched.matchReason: Both findings identify the same XSS vulnerability in the xss20 endpoint where user input is unsafely inserted into an img src attribute without proper encoding. The actual finding provides a detailed technical analysis demonstrating how the blacklist filter protecting this endpoint can be bypassed using HTML entity encoding (e.g., ( for '(' and ) for ')'). The vulnerability allows arbitrary JavaScript execution despite the presence of basic character filtering, which matches the expected finding's description of 'XSS vulnerability in the xss20 endpoint where user input is unsafely inserted into an img src attribute, allowing script execution despite basic character filtering'.

extra.title: Server Information Disclosure via HTTP Headers
extra.assessment: New discovery - not in expected findings list. Application exposes detailed version information (Werkzeug/1.0.1 Python/2.7.18) through HTTP Server header across all responses. While not in the expected findings, this is a legitimate security issue that could facilitate targeted exploitation of known CVEs for the disclosed versions.

extra.title: Broken Endpoint Reference Revealing Application Structure
extra.assessment: New discovery - not in expected findings list. Homepage contains hyperlink to non-existent 'xss25' endpoint that returns HTTP 404, revealing incomplete or removed functionality. This is a valid information disclosure vulnerability that could assist attackers in mapping application structure, though it was not part of the expected findings.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers
extra.assessment: New discovery - not in expected findings list. Application lacks critical security headers including X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options, Content-Security-Policy, and Strict-Transport-Security. This is a valid security misconfiguration that should have been included in the expected findings, as these headers provide defense-in-depth protection against multiple attack vectors.
